Throws: if the object does not hold an int value

Parameters: the new value that this objects holds
setFloat(float).Description: Updates this value object to represent a float value. Any previous values associated with this object are erased.

Parameters: the new value for the given key
setKeyValue(java.lang.String, float).Description: Updates the value for a given key in the map to the given float value. Any previous values associated with the key are erased. This method can be used only on @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#data#Field#FORMAT_MAP_E@ values. Key values should be kept small whenever possible. This is specially important for high frequency streams, since large keys may result in down sampling.

Parameters: the new value that this objects holds
setString(java.lang.String).Description: Updates this value object to represent a string value. Any previous values associated with this object are erased. String values should be kept small whenever possible. This is specially important for high frequency streams, since large values may result in down sampling.

Returns: one of the format constants from @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#data#Field_E@
getFormat().Description: Returns the format of this value, which matches the appropriate field in the @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#data#DataType_E@ definition.

ClassDesc: Holder object for the value of a single @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#data#Field_E@ in a @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#data#DataPoint_E@. Values are not constructed directly; a value for each field of the @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#data#DataType_E@ is created for each data point. A field value has a particular format, and should be set and read using the format-specific methods. For instance, a float value should be set via @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#data#Value#setFloat_E@ and read via @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#data#Value#asFloat_E@. Formats are defined as constants in @B_com#google#android#gms#fitness#data#Field_E@
